18:22 GMT
"The firearms squad is in place, sir," said a lone voice over the intercom, sounding like a crack of thunder, after a couple of hours of silence.

It was six twenty-two, Commander. I happened to glance at the clock.
He held open the door wide. It seemed less an invitation to leave than a command.
Clock overturned when he fell forward. That'll give us the time of the crime. Twenty-two minutes past six.
